awd_titl_txt: Laser Interferometry Measurement System for Mechanical      Vibration Research
awd_abstract_narration: 9311215  Wickert    In this project a laser interferometry system is developed for  conducting experimental research in the areas of vibration,  acoustics and dynamics. Specific projects include the dynamics of  axially moving materials and devices such as high speed magnetic  and magneto-optical tapes, and power transmission chairs and  belts. Also, the dynamics of micromechanical structures is  investigated to identify the vibration issues that become  significant when mechanical structures are significantly down-  sized, for instance, through silicon micro-machining techniques.  Characterizing the dynamics of such systems is generally  challenging since the fundamental vibration frequencies can be  extremely high, with the vibration amplitudes being in the sub-  micron range. The interferometer used in the project has a laser  spot size between 10 and 100 pem, a bandwidth of a least 500 khz;  and a resolution that is variable between 0.008 pem and 20 pem  for displacement measurements, and between 0.5 pem/sec and 10  pem/sec for velocity measurements. The system provides a reliable  vehicle for obtaining fundamental understanding of micro-  mechanical structural dynamics.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
